findings.lung: Bilateral lower lobe atelectasis and a 2 mm pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe which is unchanged.
findings.abdomen: Fluid filled and dilated appendix up to 11 mm in diameter, surrounded by a small amount of free fluid and moderate mesenteric fat stranding. No pneumoperitoneum or organized fluid collection. Liver enhances homogeneously with numerous subcentimeter hypodensities likely representing simple cysts or biliary hamartomas.
findings.pelvis: Normal rectum and urinary bladder. No pelvic free fluid or mass.

other_tests.changes_over_time: Unchanged pulmonary nodule in the left lower lobe.
